body.pretty:
⊢ c0 ∈ NrmCVec
⊣ ℂ = ran(+)
⊣ 0 =(GId ` +)
⊣ < +, × > ∈ CVecOLD
⊣ (abs : ℂ → ℝ)
⊣ ((hs0 ∈ ℂ ∧(abs ` hs0)= 0)→ hs0 = 0)
⊣ ((hs1 ∈ ℂ ∧ hs0 ∈ ℂ)→(abs `(hs1[×]hs0))=((abs ` hs1)[×](abs ` hs0)))
⊣ ((hs0 ∈ ℂ ∧ hs1 ∈ ℂ)→(abs `(hs0[+]hs1))[≤]((abs ` hs0)[+](abs ` hs1)))
⊣ c0 = < < +, × >, abs >
⊣ d(hs0, hs1)

⊣ d(hs0, +)
⊣ d(hs0, ×)
⊣ d(hs0, abs)
⊣ d(hs1, ℂ)
⊣ d(hs1, +)
⊣ d(hs1, ×)
⊣ d(hs1, abs)

comment: The set of complex numbers is a normed complex vector space. The vector operation is ` + ` , the scalar product is ` x. ` , and the norm function is ` abs ` . (Contributed by Steve Rodriguez, 3-Dec-2006.) (New usage is discouraged.)
